qas.question: How can function problems typically be restated?
If two integers are multiplied and output a value, what is this expression set called?

answers.text: the set of triples (a, b, c) such that the relation a × b = c holds

qas.question: What can not be restated as decision problems?
What is the expression set called where three integers are multiplied?

plausible_answers.text: Deciding whether a given triple is a member of this set

qas.question: What corresponds to solving the problem of multiplying three numbers/

context: It is tempting to think that the notion of function problems is much richer than the notion of <a0_0>decision problems<a0_0/>. However, this is not really the case, since <b2_0>function problems<b2_0/> can be recast <a0_1><a0_2>as decision problems<a0_2/><a0_1/>. For example, the multiplication of two integers can be expressed as <a1_2><b3_0>the <a1_0>set of triples<b3_0/><a1_0/> (a, b, c) such that the relation a × b = c holds<a1_2/>. <b4_0>Deciding whether a given <a1_1>triple<a1_1/> is a member of this set<b4_0/> corresponds to solving the problem of multiplying two numbers.
